intro: Clematis hagiangensis, commonly known as the Hagiang clematis, is a rare flowering plant native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, typically blue or purple flowers. The plant features compound leaves with three to five leaflets and has a woody stem covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
